node.title: 'It didn't shock the PM himself': Brittany Higgins and Grace Tame say politicians knew depth of harassment in parliament
node.alt: A woman with brown hair wears a burgundy jacket.
node.description: Brittany Higgins says Prime Minister Scott Morrison rebuffed suggestions she made in April that were similar to recommendations inÂ the Jenkins report on misconduct in parliament.
node.content:
["Brittany Higgins and Grace Tame say until concrete changes are made in Parliament House they\u00a0will not trust the words they have heard from politicians about changing the culture and making it a safer place\u00a0to work.", "Earlier this week, a report by sex discrimination commissioner Kate Jenkins found one\u00a0in three\u00a0people working in federal parliament had\u00a0experienced some kind of sexual harassment there.", "Ms Higgins said the report would not have come as a surprise to many who worked there.", "\"I don't think it shocked anyone. It didn't even shock the Prime Minister himself.\u00a0It's been rampant in that building,\"\u00a0she told RN Breakfast.", "\"We've yet to see real decisive action from the Prime Minister on this, or at least a firm commitment that he's actually committed to changing things.\"", "Upon receiving the report, Prime Minister Scott Morrison said he was appalled.", "\"Like anyone who works in this building, I find the statistics that are presented here, of course, appalling and disturbing,\"\u00a0he said on Tuesday.", "\"I wish I found them more surprising, but I find them just as appalling.\"", "Ms Tame said she did not know whether anything had actually changed at Parliament House or whether the Prime Minister would act on all the recommendations.", "\"So this is not new information to him and yet nothing has really changed,\" she said.", "", "
Grace Tame said she felt nothing had really changed yet at Parliament House.(ABC News: Maren Preuss)
", "Ms Higgins said\u00a0the review's recommendations, including that an independent office enforced a code of conduct for MPs and staffers, were obvious changes that had to be made.", "The commissioner said when handing down her review that Ms Higgins's public stand had been a catalyst for the review.", "\"The impact of her bravery is immeasurable,\" Ms Jenkins said.", "
Questions over how many recommendations will be implemented
", "The review made 28\u00a0recommendations, but both Ms Higgins and Ms Tame questioned how many of them would be implemented.", "Ms Higgins said she raised some of the same recommendations and ideas at a meeting with the Prime Minister in April, but she felt\u00a0they were rebuffed.", "\"I personally raised, you know, some of the structural reform ideas to the Prime Minister in April when we met and he sort of rebuffed it with the, you know, 'It's your right to ask, it's my right to consider,'\" she said.", "\"And at the moment, the Prime Minister's word\u00a0is a little wobbly.", "\"We don't know when he gives an indication that he's supportive of policy that he is actually going to commit to it.\"", "Ms Tame said it was disturbing to read that participants interviewed by the review\u00a0felt people perpetrating misconduct had continued in their roles or were even promoted.", "\"Not only is there such a high prevalence\u00a0in this workplace, in parliament, of things like harassment and bullying and sexual assault, but offenders are actually rewarded and often promoted,\" she said.", "Ms Higgins asked parliamentarians to reflect on the legacy they intended to leave.", "\"I think there has to be sort of a stocktaking moment of this parliament to consider what legacy would you like to leave\u00a0because this\u00a0transcends politics,\" she said.", "\"It's in the Liberals, it's in the Nationals, it's in the Greens and I've heard it from\u00a0so many men and women across the spectrum.", "
Tame and Higgins reflect on 2021
", "Publicly telling their stories was all about creating change,\u00a0both women\u00a0told RN Breakfast's Fran Kelly in the final interview\u00a0she conducted as presenter of RN Breakfast.", "\"I know that\u00a0my disclosure has become emblematic of something bigger than myself\u00a0and, with that, I know it's an immense privilege,\" Ms Higgins said.", "", "
Former political staffer Brittany Higgins met Prime Minister Scott Morrison in April this year.(AAP: Dean Lewins)
", "Ms Tame said any resistance to the issues the two women had raised this year\u00a0was inevitable in creating change.", "\"We've got a really disturbingly high number of survivors in the community, which can only mean that there's a really high number of perpetrators,\" she said.", "\"These people aren't on the fringes of society, they are everyday people\u00a0and\u00a0those behaviours have been\u00a0so entrenched.", "\"When we start to\u00a0bring those dark things into the light and challenge certain people's way of life, you're going to get resistance, but\u00a0that is also\u00a0what makes change.\"", "Ms Tame said it had been a unique experience to get to know Ms Higgins.", "\"It's been wonderful to get to know Brittany,\" she said.", "\"There are very few people who understand this unique intersection of experiences \u2014 being a survivor of something incredibly traumatic, but then that being the focus of your advocacy and therefore being in the limelight and under intense public scrutiny.\""]
